website_summaries.verdict: Specifically designed for CrossFit workouts, this jump rope scores well for its unparalleled speed and durability.
pros: Unique quadruple ball-bearing system offers smooth rotation
Lightweight coated steel cable for fast-paced workouts
Great for double, and even triple unders
Available in a variety of colors
Includes spare hardware and carry bag
cons: Nylon resin handles get slippery during intensely sweaty workouts

customer_reviews.title: Very Fast!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best speed ropes I have ever used! Great for single unders, double unders, and even triple unders. The rope is smooth and very fast and has enough weight to give you momentum on your swings. It is super nice that it comes with a spare rope and all replacement hardware. In all it is a fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew & Amanda Duininck

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews, and the fact this jump rope has another set of bearings in the handle, I thought this jump rope would be faster than the speed rope I already have. Unfortunately, this rope was impossible to jump with. It came rolled up and kept a wavy form even when trying to jump rope. Jump roping with a curvy rope is a bad idea. I even hung it up in attempt to straighten it out. Sadly, it hasn’t straightened out, and I can’t return it because I’ve already trimmed the rope.
customer_reviews.author: Clav

customer_reviews.title: All ropes are created equal, some are less equal
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought that these were great jump ropes. But then the flaws started showing themselves. First it was the coating on the rope itself, wearing away from daily use. Then the nuts kept coming loose, no matter how hard or often I tightened them.
customer_reviews.author: Pogo

customer_reviews.title: Old Fart Jumps Rope Without Injury! Thanks WOD Nation.
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery of this item was greatly appreciated. Clear instructions on adjusting the jump rope for our different heights made getting ready to use it a breeze. OK, it's a speed rope. I knew that when I bought it and thought to myself that I could get used to it within a week or so. I am nearly 70 years old and surprised myself by actually getting comfortable with is in just a few days! My wife loves hers, and I really enjoy mine. WOD Nation speed jump rope has become part of my early morning routine of walking, weight lifting, and jumping rope. Impressively, it now comes before morning coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Bogan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Jump-rope
customer_reviews.text: Different from any jump-rope I've ever used. Super smooth. Its light weight is taking me a bit of time to adapt to, but it's a really slick design. Well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: William B

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased! It's great!
customer_reviews.text: Really pretty color! Looks like really good quality! It did come with the extra screws and parts which was awesome. It seems great! I was shopping around alot and glad I picked this brand. I haven't full on tested it for double unders yet. I'm going to take it to the gym to get help with cutting it to size, I don't want to mess up the sizing lol. The cool thing is there is another rope too tho! Really good quality, great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S

customer_reviews.title: Rope wears away after a month
customer_reviews.text: It's a great rope, easily adjustable and super fast... but after a month of daily use, the plastic covering around the wire wore off and the wires are exposed. It's now easy to catch a shoelace on it, or a finger (which is pretty painful and results in having to very carefully extract it). It comes with two ropes so I'm going to replace it with the other one, but I doubt it'll last that much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Appa Ate Momo

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for harder surface
customer_reviews.text: I got this rope for my crossfit , this is a decent rope for indoors , but the moment I did jump rope on hard surface , the coating came off and the wire inside started to fall off, I had a cut in my finger and it started getting tangled on my joggers. I won’t recommend it , there are better options available
customer_reviews.author: Ritesh Shrivastava

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these, one for moi and one for my girlfriend. Mine broke exactly 1 month and a day into it, just out of my return date. Hers, the bearing on one side is stiffer, and not as fast as it was. Bad purchase. Will upload pictures later tonight
customer_reviews.author: The LG

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: As the other critical reviews state, this rope has some issues that are common. the rope is too light. It feels wobbly when you jump and try to do double unders because it loses slack. I'm not sure why that is, but I wasn't able to perform with this rope. It broke on me my first time going hard with Double unders. The screws don't stay in well and it seems like you get what you pay for. I'll be looking for a more heavy duty and generally sturdier rope next time I buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: I love this Jump rope
customer_reviews.text: I've been crossfitting (is that what it's called now?) for almost 6 years, and was already pretty decent at jumping rope. Double unders weren't hard for me to learn, and I've bought this same brand twice for myself and once for my son who barely uses his rope. I love it for the price and its efficiency. I have never bought the higher priced ropes, but don't see any point since these work just fine. they do shred. but it takes LOTS of WODS for it to do that - and be smart, don't use them on concrete. They'll last longer
customer_reviews.author: krystelline419

customer_reviews.title: It might be good if you already have double unders... but not that good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice solidly built sturdy jump rope, but I have two problems with it: - it is slower and requires significantly more effort to spin than simple Rogue speed ropes that my crossfit box has - rubber-coated steel cable brings EXTREMELY painful hits when you misstep I guess all that is okay if you already know the technique for double unders, but if you're just learning, you WILL hit yourself, and maybe a softer rope material is better for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: Decent rope, indoor use only.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rope because of the reviews. However, the rope wore bare to the metal braid in under an hour of jumping outside on the sidewalk. The metal braid not only exposed, but frayed to the point of sharp strands protruding out that punctured my finger. As an indoor rope it should last fine. Although, I do prefer the thicker styled ropes—this is very, very thin and has an inherent coil to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Starting to jump rope ... at 61
customer_reviews.text: Walk daily, ride a Schwinn cruiser for variety, needed a quick ‘peak cardio’ blast activity. The 10 minute ‘how to start’ jumping rope is a perfect fill for now. See this becoming more with COVID impacting gym membership. WOD rope is a quality item - nice handles, easy length adjustments, nice color(s), extra bits included along with extra rope and carry bag - great overall value and excellent price/start point for an older beginner.
customer_reviews.author: OldArchitect

customer_reviews.title: In love with this product!
customer_reviews.text: I never would have imagined that I could fancy a jump rope this much. For starters, right out of the packaging you can feel the quality of the materials. You're getting a high quality jump rope, with a spare replacement rope for an excellent price. The handles are rock solid & durable plastic. The rope is incredibly easy to adjust to your applicable length which was nice. Literally within five minutes of opening the package I had my new jump rope cut to the desired length & commenced with the lolly gagging. No regrets on this purchase & I'm confident that this will last for quite some time. Great investment in your health. I vehemently recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.J.B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, light weight.
customer_reviews.text: I've been working on getting healthy and in better shape. I have not jump roped since elementary school. But this is light weight and easy to spin. Sizing the rope is pretty self explanatory. It has a tiny screw used to help keep pressure on the rope to keep it in place. I have only used it for about a week, and my only problems are because my ability to not screw up while jumping isn't very good.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: I waited to write this...
customer_reviews.text: I waited to review this rope, because I wanted to spend some time with it, get familiar with it and use it. At first glance, this rope is spectacular. It is light weight, adjustable, the handles are comfortable & the bearings spin freely. However, ever since I have been using this rope the adjustment screws continually come loose. At first it was every so often, but now, I have to tighten down the screws multiple times in a WOD, otherwise it goes flying off & the rope becomes useless. I wish this wasn't the case, but here we are.
customer_reviews.author: DC Baker

customer_reviews.title: rope is garbage, look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Rope is way too light to gain any real speed or good rhythm. non-weighted handles feel flimsy as can be. locking mechanism upsets the rope swing and can destroy your rhythm as well. my 5 dollar rope from 5-below was 10000 times better than this thing and i'm pissed I cant get another one due to COVID so I'm stuck using this piece of junk until stores open again.
customer_reviews.author: john d

customer_reviews.title: Jump baby
customer_reviews.text: Got this rope to learn DU’s. The clasp broke after about 5 workouts. It comes with extras so no issue. I emailed customer service and told them it broke, and they shopped me out more no charge or shipping cost! I am super happy. Stiff will brake that part of life but it’s awesome when a company stands behind their product. I would buy more from them without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Coburn

customer_reviews.title: You Won't Be Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My 15-year-old son decided to get active and asked me for a $5 jumping rope. I did go to the store and get him one. But then I thought I should get him a good one since he is serious about using it as a way of exercise. I decided on WON Nation after doing my online research/reviews. The product arrived in like one and a half days, nicely packaged, and comes with a spare set of rope/accessories and a storage pouch. Adjusting the length was easy. My son loves it and now uses it everyday. I'm also impressed with the seller's follow up effort.
customer_reviews.author: Becky S.

customer_reviews.title: Painful for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a good speed rope, just not for me. I am a beginner and have been jumping rope for about 3 months now. I had a fairly cheap starter rope to begin with and that worked fine till it snapped from use on cement. I got this one from WOD thinking I can now move on to speed jumping, but have had a tough time getting used to it. If you miss a step, you can be sure to get spanked by it and it hurts pretty hard. I'll be moving to a more heavier rope. Otherwise the package arrived on time and I had no issues with setup and getting the rope sized for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Sunil

customer_reviews.title: Nice rope
customer_reviews.text: Nice light weight jump rope. It is much different from the ropes of my earlier days. I certainly have to use my wrists and shoulders more to get it around unlike in the old ropes where they did the work for you. It is something I didn't expect to do but I am looking forward to the new experience. I also like that it came with a second rope nice unexpected surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Martin

customer_reviews.title: My go to Double Under Jump Rope
customer_reviews.text: Tried quite a few different ropes and these by far are the best I've found. The rope is the right weight, spins really well, and you can easily adjust the rope (do cut it mostly to size but having the ability to use the thumb screw and make adjustment is great). The package also comes with another rope and set of screws).
customer_reviews.author: V. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Needed duck tape to secure the ends of the rope.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this rope, but after I sized it and put the rubber end caps on - they kept flying off while I was jumping. I fooled with them 7 or 8 times. They kept flying off. I finally had to use duck tape to hold the ends on.
customer_reviews.author: BeFree

customer_reviews.title: Worthless and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Broke the 2nd time I used the jump rope in the gym it was very embarrassing. Would never order these again and should've been able to return them but I didn't waste my time.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Broke Apart in Less than 14 Days
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to use this product, and the first week and a half went really well as the jump rope is very well weighted and swings very smoothly. Nevertheless, after roughly 14 days, I looked down and the plastic part around the metal inside has already broken apart. The break occurred right in the middle of the jump rope, where it hits the ground. I have been using it everyday, but to break apart after 14 days of use is pretty pathetic. Now that the metal part is exposed, it is also breaking apart and has become quite sharp. They include a spare rope, but my assumption is it will break apart just as easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Good rope but not for long...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a WOD Nation Speed Jump Rope in January 2019 and liked using it until the swivel in the handle came loose and now it moves up and down while jumping (see attached picture). This adversely affects the swing of the rope and makes jumping more difficult. I tried to get a replacement handle, all other parts are still in good shape, but apparently no spare parts are available for order. Update: I was contacted by customer support and they sent an entire rope kit as a replacement. Happy to be using this for workouts again.
customer_reviews.author: Woodj

customer_reviews.title: NOT EASILY ADJUSTABLE!
customer_reviews.text: I have used many jump ropes in the past, but out of all this particular one really pissed me off!!! It comes with two ropes and one that was already set up for me to use, big problem was it was adjusted for someone much taller like 5’8! I am 5’3, when I tried to unscrew it to adjust it, the screws are tightly adjusted and won’t come off! I had to go out and buy a wire cutter!!! REALLY INCONVENIENT!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: stahir2

customer_reviews.title: Very nice speed rope that works
customer_reviews.text: I love this jump rope - I was new to skipping when I bought it. It came in a nice package and was easy to adjust. At first I thought that the handles were a little light but it didn’t matter at all. The rope itself has some weight to it that helps a lot while jumping. I also like that it doesn’t tangle and holds form making it always ready for use. I now have 3 ropes and this one is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great Jump Rope
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this I would just be buying jump ropes at Target, Sports Authority and they would keep breaking. I skip rope about 10-15 minutes daily on hardwood and these have lasted me over a year. some of the rubber/plastic has fallen off where it contacts the ground but thats expected and doesn't affect how it works. they also provided a separate/backup rope but i haven't used it yet. the bag is a nice touch too. if you want to get into jumping rope, buy this! Edit - 2 years later, I finally went through both pairs of rope. I am more than pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: gookie

customer_reviews.title: Seems real good
customer_reviews.text: Nice jump rope. The handles are very light weight plastic. I have not had any cracks or breaks, and not that the plastic seems cheap or fragile necessarily, but I must say I worry a little bit every time I drop them on a hard floor. Time will tell if they hold up. Otherwise it's well constructed. Trimming the cable was easy. The bearing/clamp assembly has not come loose on me at all yet. Super nice that you get a replacement cable when wears down or if you need a different size. Would buy again for sure. Now I just need to use it more and stop sucking at jump rope.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 20 year old son who wanted to incorporate jumping rope to his cardio routine. It has been two weeks of use and the first wire is wasted. The outer fabric wore through and dangerous barbs of wire are sticking out. We installed the second wire. It has been two weeks and we have the same issues. That is it! this product went in the trash before it hurts someone.
customer_reviews.author: Patriotic purchaser

customer_reviews.title: GREAT quality and LOVE the color!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the purple. The overall rope itself is perfect. I’ve been into CrossFit for about 5 month now and I’ve been waiting to buy my own rope for class and I’m so happy I finally did. Super easy to adjust and I can do my DU’s without any problems. Very happy with my purchase! Also love the fact that it comes WITH extra bearings and a replacement rope for when the other one wears out! Definitely going to recommend to people I know!
customer_reviews.author: Jayme Havens

customer_reviews.title: jump rope is an activity that I love the most
customer_reviews.text: This jump rope is my 6th kind and THIS IS A WINNER. As it mentions, ball bearings and metal attachments make a whole lot of difference. I do numerous intense tricks, jump rope is an activity that I love the most. This rope skips smoothly and fast, does exactly what it is suppose to be doing. Even better that it comes with extra rope, extra screws and attachments and bag. I have used this already for long time, only indoors and feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Great produce! Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I'm really impressed. I debated over the multitude of jump ropes available here on Amazon, and finally chose this one purely based on the color. I mean what girl doesn't want a pink jump rope? But after a week of using this one, I'm super happy with it. It was simple to snip off the end to adjust the length for my height and that was all I needed to do to get ready to use it. The handles are comfortable and turn smoothly and the rope is a nice weight.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Steele of Fresh Eggs Daily

customer_reviews.title: I thought it would be longer
customer_reviews.text: I think it's going to work -- barely. I'm six foot two and the rope feels a little short. I thought based on the description that it would be plenty long and I'd just cut it to fit. For 5 stars, I think I'd need another 16 inches or so, just to be sure I had plenty. Other than that, it seems like a fine rope (I guess actually a cable) at a fair price. The extra cable and little carry bag are a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: A. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: The cost for two ropes at this price and for this quality can't be touched!
customer_reviews.text: Great rope! Heavier than a speed rope, but still great for jumping rope, double unders or WODS. I have been in crossfit for 5 - 6 years, competed in local and regional throw downs and this as good as any rope I have owned and you get two ropes with it. The quality is great, handles are a little longer than I am used to, but still worked great. Easy thumb adjustment for length, quick rope and quality deal; two ropes, set of handles, extra thumb screws, end caps to the rope and a carrying bag. The cost for two ropes at this price and for this quality can't be touched.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative
customer_reviews.text: As we are in lock down, my family wanted something active to do while staying relatively close to our home. We are usually surrounded by people who jog or walk their dogs without masks on so we prefer to do something active inside our home or just in the front/back yard. This is where these jump rope came in. They're a great set and have been doing quite well after several months of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Jelly

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rope being new to crossfit style workouts and looking to improve on my single under skills with the hopes of working up to doubleunders. I'm no expert (have not picked up a jump rope since elementary school!) but I love having a rope at home to practice with that I can size to my needs. This feels like a quality product and I prefer it to the ones available at my gym
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Not bad if you're trying to give yourself a challenge
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a Rogue SR-1, but my gym bag was stolen from my car, and I figured with all the positive reviews and how much cheaper this rope is, I would give this a shot. It's heavier. MUCH heavier. I'd say that 30 DU's with this rope is about the equivalent of 40 with the SR-1. Not bad if you're trying to give yourself a challenge, but you're not going to be able to keep up with the guys who have the more expensive ropes. Props for how easy it is to adjust though - much better than the tiny screws that come with the Rogue ropes.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great speed rope, indoors only
customer_reviews.text: I jump alot and have many ropes to show. I buy the pricey crossropes, but I'm always looking for lower cost solutions as I go through many over time. Crossropes last, but you pay a premium price. These are great for the price and they last very long, but they are for indoor use only. I do not recommend these for outdoor use. The length is adjustable and easy, they give you two wires (ropes) and one set of handles. Overall please with this purchase. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R BTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth Your Money
customer_reviews.text: This thing just feels cheap. It was a pain to get sized correctly and once it finally was, jumping with it wasn’t that nice. The rope is light, but the handles have no weight to them. It just feels awkward to use. It’s hard to get a good rhythm due to the low weight. I’ve paid less for better ropes. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Literally blazing speed rope
customer_reviews.text: Literally blazing fast. The length is adjustable and the bearings are awesome. I did double-unders immeidately. This jump rope helps with your double under practice but you need to know how to do double under. This rope does not give you special powers but it gives you confident that when you spin the darn rope, it won't snag and whips you right on your thigh or arms.
customer_reviews.author: Care Bear

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Seemingly good quality, but after a week’s use, the rope started to fall apart and the print on handles is smudging off. Not sure how long it would last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap and not worst, less than OK
customer_reviews.text: I am not a pro in skipping but can go up to 100-230 unbroken. I have done that a lot of times with other ropes. However, with this rope, I am never able to go beyond than 35 and the reason I feel is the weight of the rope. These are not as heavy as they should be, I am getting stuck all the time. These ropes aren’t too light but not as heavy as needed.
customer_reviews.author: marcelo rey

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Jump Ropes!
customer_reviews.text: Really like these jump ropes! I decided to buy these because I can no longer do sprints for cardio workouts. These work really well and I'm really happy that I'm back into jump roping after so many years! Great workout! Anyway, these are excellent quality jump ropes that are adjustable in size. They come with all necessary parts you may need, but you will need some cutters if you plan on shortening them. I really like the blue ones! And I'm glad I have a spare black one in case the blue ones no longer hold up!
customer_reviews.author: Usman Khan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality speed jump rope
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a regular jump rope with vinyl coating and just used a speed jump rope for the first time. What a difference! I love the bearings and coated steel cable on these. The only reason I am giving it 4 stars is the handles. They are thin plastic and I prefer them to have some sort of absorbent grip similar to a tennis racket to get a better grip if I am sweaty. Besides this the overall product is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: L. Suarez

customer_reviews.title: 😃 IT’S AWESOME!!! THANKS A MILLION!
customer_reviews.text: This rope ROCKS! I’ve burned out a couple ropes already and don’t suspect this one will be any different. Well, perhaps a bit earlier... Thanks to the the bearings where the rope rotates and in the handle I’m faster and far less apt to experience binding when I jump. Great job in design!! I’d like to see an improvement in the handle (slightly heavier 😁) and maybe add some armor to the center where the rope contacts the ground so I don’t have to buy them so often... 🙏🏼😉
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like this set. Came with two cables with slightly different weights. The handles are hollow plastic and are very light weight. I was skeptical at first of that construction but they seem very durable. I'm no expert so I tend to trip up on the regular and they fall to the floor. So far no complaints on durability. Just make sure you tighten everything well as they handles can come off if the set screws are not tight.
customer_reviews.author: Kjellguy

customer_reviews.title: Worst rope for begginners
customer_reviews.text: I’m surprised nobody has made a comment about this, but if you’re a beginner, this is probably not the rope for you, unless you’re a masochist. You’re going to whip your hands with thin plastic covered steel at speed about 90% of the time you stumble upon the rope. Now, if you’re trying to develop the habit and the discipline to exercise and do some good jumps, the last thing you want is to hurt yourself a little bit repeatedly during the workout, it’s annoying and takes your focus away from the real thing, at least in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Emancebo

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Update 20 Mar 16- Well, I used this during one of the CF games WODs a few weeks ago. I really like this rope. It worked fine for me doing my singles; I didn't do the double-unders. Well, I have not used it at my Crossfit class just yet, so I have yet to determine if it is a decent rope. So far I like it. It was easy to shorten since I'm very short and it turns pretty good so far. Of course, I love the color! And I appreciate that it came with a bag and extra rope. I may update my review once I actually use it at CF though, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: AtekamT

customer_reviews.title: Great value speed rope, pouch is low quality
customer_reviews.text: Really solid value with 2 ropes and durable handles. Bearing make the spin very smooth. The branding on the handles wore off quickly - but that's not really a big deal. The carrying pouch is very helpful to keep from getting tangled in my gym bag. Edit:. After just a few months the carrying pouch seam has opened up and is all but useless. Taking off a star because the pouch to me was a purchase driver. It was poorly made with lots of loose strings inside that constantly snagged on the rope going on and coming out.
customer_reviews.author: Jebediah Springfield

customer_reviews.title: NOT recommended (by manufacturer) for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for customer support...got a nice email from them on usage tips, etc....they seem to actually care about their customers. BUT, I had to return the product as they say (within the above-mentioned welcome email) that it should **only be used indoors**. I tried to find out whether I could use it outside (on concrete) before I purchased but there was nothing in the description. One of the Q&A responses from users said that they did use it outside without issue, which is why I went ahead and bought it. I don't belong to a gym (ergo wanting a concrete-friendly rope to use in the park) so as much as I'd like to keep it, I won't.
customer_reviews.author: ブレー

customer_reviews.title: Great rope
customer_reviews.text: I love this jump rope. I was so frustrated that I couldn't get D/U's that I purchased this so I could practice at home. Some of the ropes at my box were too thin and light and others were too heavy and bulky but this one is honestly perfect. It was easy to trim to the length I needed and it's offered in fun colors, which we all know makes your performance improve :) I definitely recommend this jump rope.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rope!
customer_reviews.text: The unboxing of the rope consisted of two opens as described with hardware installed on one and additional hardware included. Right out of the box there was and included card on how to set up a rope as well as a video available on YouTube which was great. I set up the rope and I was off to workout. The rope is very fast and once tightened the rope fasteners work great. If I want to adjust the length at all at a whim it is done in seconds. Thanks for a great speed rope!
customer_reviews.author: Wesley M.

customer_reviews.title: Painful jump rope
customer_reviews.text: Stings like a bee when you mess up. Myself and another who are both experienced with jump ropes, one of whom used to box and use leather ropes, each ended up with large hives/welts on the arms and legs. This went in the garbage on the first day.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K.

customer_reviews.title: Like the description says this rope is fast!
customer_reviews.text: This jump rope is an excellent piece of kit. I've used weighted jump ropes in the past that turn slower so it's easier to pace yourself and provides a different kind of a workout. The WOD jump rope is just plain fast! Yes, you can go slow with it but when you pick up speed that is where this rope shines. Double, triple unders this rope will do those no problem. Fast crossovers, no problem. Oh and adjusting the rope length is very easy and the extra rope allows you to create another rope for different types of workouts. Great product and certainly worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Bryon Hundley

customer_reviews.title: Great for Crossfitters
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife and she really loves it. We crossfit and if you want to good at double unders it really helps to have your own jump rope. The green color is cool and the design is different but the rope is really smooth and fast. Easy to put together initially with the instructions. Also customer service was great and emailed to see how we were liking the product.
customer_reviews.author: gtturner

customer_reviews.title: Not for athletes
customer_reviews.text: This is an okay jump rope. Comes with tools to customize fit, I just wished the handles were a bit heavier and studier than the light plastic material is all. This is good for beginners and not period that like to do high or speed jumps. The wire hurts when it hits your body, so be careful marks will be left!
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Great rope but tighten it
customer_reviews.text: Really love this jump rope. I was not able to do any double unders with the gym jump rope, but now that I have this one my skill has progressed significantly and I'm now able to do some and am well on my way to stringing them together. Recommend tightening this rope with pliers, otherwise it can come undone in the middle of a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan.
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of this jump rope. The rope would shorten as I used since the adjustable screw clamps did not hold the rope in place. Every time I used it I would have to stop and shake the slack down because the rope would get caught around my feet. Then the clamp on one side came off. Then later the other side broke. I replaced with another brand/style.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: One of the best ropes I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this probably one of the best jump ropes I’ve ever used. Jump roping became one of my hobbies over quarantine and as a fairy new beginner this product was very easy to use and quickly accustomed to. It’s very fun to use and makes for a great low impact workout. In the past couple months that I’ve been using this, I’ve already been seeing results in my own cardio endurance. This rope is very fast and light weight, I can honestly recommend this anyone even those who to a beginner like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Harry DeGuzman

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: So I used this for about 2 weeks in May 2020 while the covid 19 pandemic since all gyms were closed and it is already broken. Not a good product in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: ALVI

customer_reviews.title: I love this new jump rope
customer_reviews.text: I love this new jump rope! The covered steel cable has just enough weight to help improve my skills. I haven't achieved the elusive double under yet, but I think this rope will help me get there. I especially like that it comes in its own bag which makes it easy for me to take to workouts. It doesn't become tangled like many other ropes I have tried. It was a cinch to adjust, which is important since I'm only 5'1" tall. I've bought two other products that did not perform well. This one is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Yoho

customer_reviews.title: Durabilty
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty lightweight jump rope, but probably not suitable for beginners. Also, it might be better if indoor use only. I've used this rope for less than 10 times since I got it. The coating/layer started wear out and wire inside even pricked my finger.
customer_reviews.author: Chian Long

customer_reviews.title: I use mine for Crossfit
customer_reviews.text: The gym’s jump ropes aren’t in the best condition since they are used so often by everyone and I wanted my own. Its sturdy and stands out! I’ve gotten a few compliments on it already lol. I don’t use it every time only on occasion when the workout calls for it so it will probably last longer than someone who uses it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa M

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Light
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a leather rope with wood handles this WOD jump rope is worlds different. Unfortunately I've just boggered up a knee and haven't had much time on it yet but have cut it to length and tested briefly. Oh my! This thing is fast! Hopefully will get some great use out of it on a 115 day cruise. Last time on the ship everyone thought that bringing a jump rope was the best way to stay in shape while having fun doing it. Looking forward to using this new rope......
customer_reviews.author: folmonty

customer_reviews.title: Great rope for double unders
customer_reviews.text: I learned double unders using this rope, and when the cable got all kinked up (I was storing it wrong, and lost the back up cable) I tried another brand I could not get back into it...so I bought another one of these right away. The handles stay in place with a cable locks (it think thats what they are called), which was key for me. The other rope I tried didn't have those and the handles moved too much. The cable is the perfect weight, its moves smoothly, and the storage pouch is handy.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This product fell apart within one month. I used it four times to do double unders, and the inside of the right handle broke. The washers that hold it together somehow slipped out and the rope separated from the handle during my workout this morning. Not a durable product. Fell apart quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ryan Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this. The Bearings allow me to jump fast and it is a great workout. My favorite workouts are when you don’t need a lot of expensive equipment. I’m a runner so a good pair of shoes is all I really need. With this I was able to get a great workout 20 minutes of jumping. Takes up little space and it’s something I’ll use while traveling for work. Just need a small space in the hotel room and you can get a great sweaty workout. Takes up no space really in my suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: brandon rees

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Got one for myself, and a few weeks later got one for my wife. We love the colors, the sleek look, the light weight, the no tangles, the little baggie, the stickers, shall I go on? Fine...the extra rope, the easy instructions, the extra screws, the fun email making sure you're satisfied with the product... All in all, seems like a great company that enjoys making a quality and affordable speed jump rope. Will probably get a couple more as small gifts for folks during the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality materials for the money
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality materials— rope material itself is brittle and handles are cheap thin plastic. Can’t believe they are sold at this high price! So bummed out.
customer_reviews.author: Welcome Mat

customer_reviews.title: Lose the nut and you are out all your money.
customer_reviews.text: If you lose the nut for the jump rope and you are out all your money. I don't like to have to do preventative maintenance on a jump rope.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Jesionowski

customer_reviews.title: Wow, I've gotten old
customer_reviews.text: I thought jump ropes were a joke when I was young. But now that I'm older and out of shape............. This rope is great. The only thing I have to compare it to is an un-named brand I ordered previously that wasn't long enough. This one is just right. Spins easily and comes with an extra cable.
customer_reviews.author: Franz

customer_reviews.title: Having a hard time with this rope
customer_reviews.text: Got this to practice double unders but can barely do singles. Have zero problems with the jump ropes at the gym. Coach told me I need to get one that has more weight in the handle and that it's the rope not me. This rope takes more work to get going fast. Will try to return it.
customer_reviews.author: WhereRMyDragons

customer_reviews.title: only if it was a bit heavier
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner. I just started to jump rope, it is better than what I had at home. I find few problems: 1. It was very difficult to cut the rope even with a good wire cutter. 2. It is light and i would prefer a heavier rope instead. 3. It hurts bad in hands if you step on it while jumping. I wear shoes while jumping, but I guess i should wear gloves as well??
customer_reviews.author: nagstrikes

customer_reviews.title: Quality good, extra parts a bonus, but maybe not for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Seems a quality product. The extra cable and extra parts are a nice plus. But where it was said that a speed rope is good for beginners, I wouldn't say that - it really helps to have some feedback, when you're just getting started. WOD Nation has another one here with both speed and weighted ropes in the same package, beginners might want to try that one to start.
customer_reviews.author: barry

customer_reviews.title: Not great but not terrible
customer_reviews.text: Not the fastest, most comfortable, or sturdiest handles. Cheap plastic with no grip and odd shape make it annoying to hold and it’s more difficult rotation makes long sessions a drag. Overall there are better ropes but there are worse ones.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Buy this rope and no others
customer_reviews.text: Good quality speed rope for those looking to add a little cardio to their life. Highly recommend spending the extra bit of money on this rope, opposed to spending half on other products. You will get what you pay for, remember that. You're going to need a pair of wire cutters to trim the rope. You can get them anywhere for $5, I went to Lowes.
customer_reviews.author: alexuria

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: The weight of the rope is nice but the way the cord and the handles come together is an issue for me. I find that when doing long periods of jumping that the excess inch of cord at the end, as required per their instructions, gets caught on the handle and then makes the rope wobble just enough to throw it off.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this jump rope because of the great reviews. I cut it as directly and I am super disappointed. I actually went to a local sporting goods store to live up a $9 that works a million times better. Now I am stuck with a jump rope that I will never use because I cut it. Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Ok.
customer_reviews.text: Works as a jump rope, but the metal screws by the handles are too big and heavy and made it seem clunky and hard to turn. My gym owner had smaller pieces and replaced them, it is still clunky. It is mine now, so I will just have to keep using it and hope I get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: KHenry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Speed Rope
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent. The quality for the price is a steal. Product came exactly as advertised. I would compare this rope to the Rogue SR-2. In regards to functionality, they are mirror images of each other. The significant difference is the SR-2 has aluminum handles, which in my opinion are not needed. There for you get a much better return on your investment with the WOD Nation Speed Rope. It's exceptionally fast and will have you doing doubles in no time.
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice rope
customer_reviews.text: It's always a rare surprise when something of good quality is also affordable. This speed rope is blazing fast and sturdy. It comes with a backup rope and extra fasteners. It's a trifle lighter than expected, but that's ok, because it makes me move my arms vigorously. The extra effort can only help !! The WOD Nation's customer relation staff is proactive and helpful. ( Special Note to WOD Nation, Gimme 50. )
customer_reviews.author: John Tailor 2048

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Best Offer Out There
customer_reviews.text: Incredible purchase! It's very quick, functional, and the flexibility to adjust it as needed really impressed my WOD buddies. Not to mention the price point vs other company's is so drastic. If you're stuck on what to get, and looking for your first rope, or replacing an old one, this is my recommendation. You're going to get way more bang for your buck, it comes with a replacement cable, and WOD Nation will send you several emails to ensure you are fully satisfied w your product. I can't speak highly enough about the jump rope, the company, or my experience. WOD Nation, I'll be browsing your other wares for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: A really good jump rope and WOD stood behind their product
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice product. I'm new to jumping rope but found that this one was easy to adjust, is easy to hold (I have big hands and the longer handles are a big help) and easy to use to develop a rhythm and more consecutive jumps. I had a minor problem with the jump rope at first but WOD took care of making it right and appreciate them coming through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and nice upgrade from your old jump ropes
customer_reviews.text: Satisfying to use as the jump rope feels snappy and crisp. Does hurt your shins if you mess up. Definitely makes me concentrate a bit harder to jump higher towards the end of each set of jumping. Easy to adjust and cut jump rope steel cable to your size. Comes with an extra set of steel jump rope. Overall good quality for a jump rope and a nice upgrade if you have an old jump rope.
customer_reviews.author: Tik Sing Wong

customer_reviews.title: Ok jump rope
customer_reviews.text: this is a good jump rope, i used it for crossfit. I eventually switched to a rogue fitness rope because it actually has bearings that move, and a better handle. But if you are looking for inexpensive rope then i would def recommend purchasing this product. prod good for the novice crossfit people.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Leventhal

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son, who's a senior in high school and works out regularly and is a wrestler. He wore out his last jump rope, so I wanted to get something that was sturdier, which is why I purchased the WOD Nation Speed Jump Rope. He's been using it for a couple of weeks, and he says it's the best speed rope he's ever had. The cable, handles, and hardware all appear well made; I expect he'll have it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: HeaJay

customer_reviews.title: Caution Taller Athletes
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the rope so far. I really like that you can tighten the collars that hold the rope without a tool. A word of caution to taller people considering purchasing this rope. If the rope were any shorter, it wouldn't have worked for me. I am 6'5" and the cable is the perfect length for me, luckily, but if I were any taller it would be too short.
customer_reviews.author: Randall L.

customer_reviews.title: The best jump rope
customer_reviews.text: This is the best jump rope i have ever had. It is really light and fast. It makes my jumping and double unders more fun. And i like it comes with extra rope. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Martina Filipova

customer_reviews.title: I want to like this rope
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this rope, I really do. My problem is that the handles are constantly coming off. I tighten the screws as best as I am able too, but when I get going on my dubs, the srews come loose and I end up losing a handle.
customer_reviews.author: SGC

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these 2 years ago and have used it several times a week (and still am). I never had to use the 2nd rope that it came with. In fact my jumprope is still going strong today. I bought another one because I have 2 workout bags and I’m just lazy to move it from one bag to the other. I’d buy this again if they ever break. I’d also highly recommend this brand to others.
customer_reviews.author: Meserith

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but performs like crap
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap rope. I use Rogue ropes at the gym and they are great. I am efficient and fast doing single unders. I wanted one to practice double unders at home. I can't even string together 10 single unders with this rope. It's too light and flimsy and I wacked myself in the head and feet multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Need replacement part!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved my jump rope, super light and easy to use for double under workouts....unfortunately after less than 6 mos the small part that keeps the handle on slipped off during a WOD and went flying and I could not find it :/ very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Rope
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the new jump rope just yet. I have used many of them in my crossfit class and decided I really needed one of my own. I bought one for myself and one for my son to put in our Christmas stockings. The only problem I have experienced with these jump ropes is the coating wearing off. It only happens when you use it outside on a cement surface and it takes time to do this, it is also something a little gorilla tape can fix as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: A great rope for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this rope for a couple of weeks, and it is definitely helping me make progress -- I've gotten up to 10 double unders in a row multiple times, when my best before was a very rare 5. I also appreciate the emails and videos on their website helping with how to size the ropes, plus having the extra cable takes some of the pressure off getting it right the first time. My recommendation would be to crank the thumb screws down pretty hard -- I landed on the rope in a WOD and had to go scrambling to re-attach the handle because I hadn't tightened it enough.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hirschman

customer_reviews.title: Sings Beautifully - from a former professional jump roper
customer_reviews.text: I used to compete in speed jump rope competitions, and I wanted to get back into it. Cutting it to the right length: step on the end of the rope while holding the handles, it should come to about mid ribcage. It works just as it should! I was able to maintain the same form I had when I was really into it. I'm very excited to keep up this cardio practice!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The WOD Nation speed jump rope exceeded my expectations. I am an over the road truck driver, so I use this jump rope on lots of rough surfaces. It is holding up very well! When you take it out of it’s cool little bag, be aware that the handles are not tight so you can adjust it to your height.
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Jump Rope for Double Unders
customer_reviews.text: My workouts frequently included double unders and I enjoy doing them. My gym ropes are falling apart and I knew I needed my own. I bought this rope and have been crushing the double unders with no problem. You can really rip them with this thing! Easily can do 100 du's in 40secs.
customer_reviews.author: fishbulb323

product_meta.title: WOD Nation Speed Jump Rope - Blazing Fast Jumping Ropes - Endurance Workout for Boxing, MMA, Martial Arts or Just Staying Fit - Adjustable for Men, Women and Children
feature_bullets: CUT SECONDS OR EVEN MINUTES OFF YOUR WOD TIMES - This jump rope is not only fast but also creates a very stable rope swing so you can easily recover from inaccurate swings
STOP DOING SINGLES WHEN EVERYONE ELSE IS DOING DOUBLES - After customizing this speed jump rope with a quick snip of a wire cutter you will be on your way to stringing together multiple double unders
GET IN THE BEST SHAPE OF YOUR LIFE - We designed this speed rope to not only spin fast but last a long time. If used regularly you will be in the best shape of your life!
100% SATISFACTION PROMISE - we pride ourselves on customer support. If you have any problems, we're here to help.

FOR USE ON SMOOTH SURFACES ONLY - Like all steel cable jump ropes, this rope should only be used on a smooth gym surface. Do not use on cement or asphalt as the rough surface will destroy the coating on the cable.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
